Functions¶

These functions are documented for completeness, most are not intended for the end user to call directly

Pipe module¶

The Pipe module can be run as a standalone command line interface, but is mainly designed to be used as the back end of the web interface

pipe.commandgen(command, pathname)[source]¶

Main command processing function. Parses file system to find targets and then invokes the specific action script. Runs as a generator.

Parameters:
  • command – The action script or command to be executed
  • pathname – The root path to start the search from
Returns:

Yields text reports of success/failure
pipe.doActlist(command)[source]¶

Returns a list of all the action scripts available

Parameters:command – Not used
Returns:List of scripts
pipe.doDefault(command)[source]¶

The default prefix; simply returns a list of paths containing the target

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doList(command)[source]¶

Combines the results of doRun and doRetry into a single list

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doOptlist(command)[source]¶

Returns all the program options

Parameters:command – Not used
Returns:List of options
pipe.doOptset(command)[source]¶

Sets the value of a option

Parameters:command – string formatted as “<option> <new value>”
Returns:string representation of the new option
pipe.doQuery(command)[source]¶

Returns a list of paths derived from an SQL query

Parameters:command – What is put after “WHERE” in the query
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doRetry(command)[source]¶

Returns the paths that resulted in failure in the most recent run

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doRun(command)[source]¶

Returns the paths that have been flagged by the user

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.parseAction(filename)[source]¶

Parses a script file to extract directives

Parameters:filename – The name of the script file
Returns:A list of directives
pipe.procCommand(command, pathname)[source]¶

Initialises the database and then invokes commandgen()

Parameters:
  • command – Passed to commandgen()
  • pathname – Passed to commandgen()
Returns:

None
pipe.runDisplay(path)[source]¶

Dumps contents to console. Needed as a placeholder function for commands that execute wholly in their prefix stage

Parameters:path – Prints this to the console
Returns:None
pipe.setProctabPath(pathname)[source]¶

Sets the database path

Parameters:pathname – The path to an sqlite database file
Returns:None

Web Backend¶

class backend.SocketHandler(application, request, **kwargs)[source]¶

Handler for WebSocket connections

check_origin(origin)[source]¶

To be implemented for security checks

Parameters:origin – Page originating WS request
Returns:Always “True” at the moment
on_close()[source]¶

Closes WebSocket

Returns:None
on_message(message)[source]¶

Responds to WS messages. Action is determined by first character of message

  • L: Login
  • H: Home
  • B: Back
  • V: View folder
  • F: Flag target
  • U: Unflag target
  • A: Get action list
  • R: Run the specified action
  • D: Display a file
  • C: Concatenate results
  • Q: Query the process table
  • X: Logout
Parameters:message – WS message string
Returns:None
open()[source]¶

Opens WebSocket

Returns:None
backend.addEllipse(image, x, y, a, b, theta, chan)[source]¶

Adds an ellipse to a bitmap image

Parameters:
  • image – numpy ndarray representing image
  • x – x position of centre
  • y – y position of centre
  • a – major axis
  • b – minor axis
  • theta – angle of major axis
  • chan – number of channels in image
Returns:

None
backend.current(userip)[source]¶

Get the current folder being viewed by a user

Parameters:userip – The IP address of the user (currently used as ID)
Returns:The name of the folder
backend.folderList(path, direction, userip)[source]¶

Generate an HTML listing of a folder

Parameters:
  • path – The path of the folder
  • direction – Direction of browsing (1 for going down, -1 for up)
  • userip – The IP address of the user (currently used as ID)
Returns:

HTML string
backend.getResource(filename)[source]¶

Read in specified file as single string

Parameters:filename – The name of the file to be read
Returns:A string
backend.imagemeta(imagename)[source]¶

Converts metadata in .fits file header into HTML formatted text

Parameters:imagename – Name of .fits file to open
Returns:HTML text
backend.makeFlagList()[source]¶

Calls the pipeline to get a list of the flagged paths

Returns:List of paths
backend.parseRegions(regionfile, user, fileReq)[source]¶

Extract information about sources in an image

Parameters:
  • regionfile – The .reg file specifying the ellipse of each source
  • user – The ID of the requesting user
  • fileReq – URL to locate image file
Returns:

HTML formatted table of sources, number of sources
backend.prettify(constring)[source]¶

Convert terminal colour codes to HTML

Parameters:constring – Terminal output string
Returns:HTML formatted string
backend.procMonitor(command, targetFolder, user)[source]¶

Manages the action as a child process.

Parameters:
  • command – The name of the command to run
  • targetFolder – The location to run it
  • user – The user index
Returns:

None
backend.processimage(imagename, regionfile, marker)[source]¶

Generates a PNG image from a fits file, and adds source information

Parameters:
  • imagename – Name of .fits file to work on
  • regionfile – Name of .reg file containing ellipse data
  • marker – Index of which ellipse to highlight (-1 for none)
Returns:

HTML formatted string pointing to the saved image
backend.projectInfo()[source]¶

Produces the main page containing information about the current project

Returns:HTML output
backend.setCurrent(userip, foldername)[source]¶

Sets the current folder being viewed by a user

Parameters:
  • userip – The IP address of the user (currently used as ID)
  • foldername – The name of the folder
Returns:

None
backend.setTarget(t)[source]¶

Sets the target folder

Parameters:t – The name of the new target folder
Returns:None
backend.startBackend()[source]¶

Initialises the web database (distinct from the pipeline one) and loads in user table

Returns:None
backend.target()[source]¶

Reports the target folder

Returns:The name of the current target folder
backend.usercheck(userip)[source]¶

Check if the user is valid

Parameters:userip – The IP address of the user (currently used as ID)
Returns:A session ID, or “False” if there is no such user
backend.xmlListing(path)[source]¶

Parses XML files stored in target folders

Parameters:path – The path name of the folder containing the .xml file
Returns:List of subpaths (i.e. observations) defined in the file
